alert.note: Alert for Allendale (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN AND ALLENDALE COUNTIES... At 749 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Martin, or 7 miles west of Allendale, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Allendale, Sycamore, Ulmer, Seigling, Millett, Martin and Appleton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
